story:
Short Summary

Giancarlo Gedler is an up and coming Venezuelan-American fashion designer from New York and Miami. Inspired by the many great fashion houses of today, Giancarlo uses his extensive multifaceted design background to create his collection renderings for the each season. His initial passion for fashion took him on a new design adventure with his own beach clothing line for men called Div(e)rsé, inspired while in the greek isles looking for the right gear. That was the stepping stone that lead him to discover what he really enjoyed, designing clothes. Now he is planning to come back with a full new collection of women’s couture and beachwear under his own label Giancarlo Gedler.

Now he needs your help to launch his debut fashion show for a select group of 60 attendees who have been invited from various parts of the fashion industry to view his spectacular debut women’s couture line.  This show will be crucial in introducing Giancarlo Gedler to buyers and fashion critics; a very important and necessary step for all designers to produce, as they must create that first collection to introduce themselves to the fashion industry.

A little about the designer...
Giancarlo studied architecture at the University of Caracas and later graduated from the Fashion Institute of Technology in New York and Fashion Design at Miami International University of Art and Design. Giancarlo past designer experience includes working for clients such as Isaac Mizhrahi, Oscar de la Renta, Gen Art, Diageo, Details Magazine, Glamour Magazine, Food and Wine Festival, Voss Water, Zippo, Peter Thomas Roth, June Jacobs Spa Collection, and more. Giancarlo has been a guest designer for HGTV “Freestyle”, and guest host for “Ecuatorianos en el Mundo” Aired by Ecuavisa International. 

Giancarlo's writing and art direction has been published by Ego Magazine, Basix
Magazine (Mexico), Tendencias Magazine (Spain), plus his own blog
“Sinners&Saints” a daily street fashion project. 

What We Need & What You Get

THE PROJECT

Now is the time to make that big leap from the sketches and samples to Giancarlo's first full line and fashion show.

Creating, designing and producing this wonderful but crucial opportunity for Giancarlo
also puts a lot at stake, it will be absolutely necessary for his debut collection to be the best it can be, and that means taking his creative designs and transferring them into actual pieces with impeccable tailoring. Producing a quality collection requires all of his pieces to be professionally constructed, which means costly labor.  Although he likes to sew, and see the fruit of his labor, he cannot sew an entire collection by himself. That is why he is reaching out to you Indiegogo, he needs funds to finalize the construction of the line.  But that’s not everything, once the fabrics have been found and purchased and assembled into a full 28 piece collection, he will now need to have an outlet for the collection to be debuted.  He has secured a great venue, to invite 60 key fashion industry attendees, he also needs to secure at least 12 models, hair and make-up artist, lighting and music to show the pieces properly.

In short, the design sketches are done, the fabrics have been selected, the collection is being assembled. The guest lists are being compiled and the invites drafted.  Now he needs your help to bring it home, and finalize the last remaining production items!

With funds from Indiegogo I will be able to:

1. Purchase remaining fabrics and other materials needed to
construct and finish the last of the garments in my collection.  Some
fabrics have a minimum quantity requirement.

2. Continue paying my seamstress in Miami who is finalizing my sample
line, which includes pattern production, prototype construction and final
sample construction for each garment.  

3. Pay for a Hair and make-up artist to assist in putting the look
on the models that is necessary in creating a “look” for the line, purchase any
styling accessories needed accentuate the pieces on the models such as footwear
and jewelry.

4. Hire 12 models who will do a minimum of two changes for the
debut fashion show.

5. Pay the nominal venue fee.

6. Pay for accent lighting, and sound for show.

7. Pay for a professional photographer to catalog the “look” photos
as models are prepped, and shoot the actual show for post event press releases
fashion bloggers to write up (spread the word about my collection).

What you get!

1. The great feeling of helping Giancarlo launch his debut fashion collection!

2. If you donate $25 to $99.00 you'll get a customized t-shirt design by Giancarlo Gedler, plus you can send an idea you have, and he'll incorporate that into the design,  and guide you where you can produce it. 

3. If you donate $100.00 to $499.00 you'll get a designer Giancarlo Gedler T-shirt, and the option to have your idea incorporated into a custom designer T-shirt.

4. If you donate $500.00 to $999.00 you'll get a designer scarf with the Giancarlo Gedler logo to incorporated it into your daily look, and the Giancarlo Gedler T-shirt.

4. If you go big and donate $1,000+ you'll get a personal invitation to Giancarlo's fashion show in Miami, to see first hand the debut collection and meet the designer himself, also you will get the Scarf and the Giancarlo Gedler T-shirt.

 

The Impact

Your donation will mean so much in finalizing the production for this talented designers collection.  Giancarlo has come so far in his design career and in this debut collection, now he needs your help to get over these final hurdles and see him to the finish line.

On a personal note, Giancarlo and his collection are truly representative of the American dream, he has come a long way in his career and the developments of his designs. Giancarlo has proven himself to be a successful visual designer and now needs your assistance to prove himself as a fashion designer.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let me know if you can help in other ways with the fashion show:

Spread the word: Lifestyle bloggers, media contacts, industry buyers

Production: lighting, sound contributors, music live or DJ.

Collection: Fabric discounts, seamstress, make-up artists, Hair stylists, model leads.

story:
The Project

This black t-shirt features a custom illustration of the famed 1936 Cord 810 by accomplished illustrator and graphic designer, Gran Roberts. I am a graphic designer in the collector car industry, and have a client list of work ranging from such names as Ralph Lauren, Pier 1 Imports, LaZboy, Winnebago, Toyota and Eaton and more. As an automotive enthusiast and former marketing director at the National Historic Landmark, Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum, I was always frustrated with the quality of the few available Cord related products on the market to passionate fans of the car. As an accomplished illustrator of (2) children's books and too many comic book projects to mention, I thought it was time to change that. That is where your support and help would be greatly appreciated.

This t-shirt features the famed 1936 Cord 810  automobile, designed by famed automobile designer, Gordon Buehrig, and produced by the Auburn Automobile Company. The Cord 810 featured front-wheel drive and independent front suspension; the front drive enabled the 810 to be so low, runningboards were unnecessary. The car caused a sensation at the New York Auto Show in November 1935. Many orders were taken at the show, but the cars were not ready to deliver until February. In all, Cord managed to sell only 1,174 of the new 810 in its first model year. The car is well-known for the flat front nose with a louvered grille design. In fact, the front was so similar in look, the car was often called "Coffin Nose". T-shirts are available in sizes ranging from small to 2X.

The Cord is known for all of its technical innovations, many of which are still being used in our cars today! Your support would keep the history of this "Rolling Sculpture" alive and make many auto fans very happy, allowing them to showcase history everywhere they are!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise about $1,000 in order for this project to make sense financially. 

To help us reach that goal we have set up a number of rewards that include different amounts of t-shirts, thank you cards, custom art and sketches. There is also a phone call reward where I will call a budding artist in your family and give them advice on their art and how to become a graphic designer/illustrator.

The Follow Through

As a 17 year veteran graphic designer, Illustrator, I have seen just about anything in terms of design. I am highly qualified to make this project happen and have done my research to get the needed photos from the ACD Museum personally. The pricing and quotes have been reviewed and the artwork is done. Shipping would take place in mid-February. The sketches have already began, and would ship with them. For the Custom art reward at the $250 level, please allow 6-8 weeks for the delivery of the digital drawing. The shirts would be sent directly in February.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this project with anyone that you think is a car or lover of all things design. Their family members may also be car lovers and would love a shirt. Please feel free to share away!

story:
HOW HANDI-SHIRT IDEA WAS BORN

After having a stroke about 2 years ago, I spent as much as 10-15 minutes getting my shirt all buttoned-up when getting dressed for church or to go out. I especially had trouble with my top collar button getting it ready to put on a tie. There had to be a better way.

SOLUTION

Eliminating the need for buttons by using a zipper down the front of the shirt and velcro on the sleeves and at the top to secure the neck solved the problem. It reduced my time to get a shirt on and ready for a tie from 10-15 minutes down to less than 1 minute. It's not just for people that are incapacitated but also useful to anyone who just wants to take the hassle out of getting that shirt on.

The goal of $5000.00 in funds is to be used for purchasing the material and hiring enough seamtresses to modify approximmately 120 shirts. If my goal is not reached, I will modify as many shirts as possible with the funds available. The perks for contributions of $45 or more will be one or more HANDI-SHIRTS ,therefore contributions will determine how many will be done and contributers will be the first to benefit.

THE IMPACT

If you yourself  have not experienced the difficulty in putting on a dress shirt and trying to deal  with buttons, especially the top one, then you surely know some who has. I have credibility with many friends and every one of them that I have shared this idea with is truly exicited about it. I look forward to further establishing and developing my market with the contributions I receive through this campaign.

No one will notice the difference when you wear the HANDI-SHIRT. I wear them myself and my friends marvel at the the ease of getting in and out of it.

Multiple shirts must be shipped to a single address, but can be any combination of color (light blue or white) and size you choose. I will obtain your size and color from you via e-mail at the end of the campaign. Big and tall sizes not available at this time.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP 

Do you have a father, uncle, brother or friend who may benefit from this HANDI-SHIRT? Help me to help them. Also, help me to get the word out and/or simply make a contribution.

Thank you in advance for your participation in this campaign.

Go to www.youtube.com.  Click on "videos" under BROWSE CHANNELS. Picture of video will show. Click on picture to view.

Go to "CONTRIBUTE NOW" and make your choice of 1,3 or 5 HANDI-SHIRTS or simply make a contribution that will help someone else.

story:
Hello, my name is Karan Fortson and a single woman, living in a small city of Michigan, with a disablity.  Because of this, I decided to overcome this obstacle by having a business from home. 

I've noticed that I have a natural flair for fashion that many women are attracted to.  Starting off with just a few handbags, I have become someone of interest. Women are always asking about upcoming styles and when I will have more product. The problem, I can't purchase enough handbags to jump start the business. 

In my research I found a wholesale company that will work with me for just $100 minimum. But with $500 and free shipping, this will be enough product to ensure my new handbag business. This is very exciting for me, because I know what the average woman is looking for. 

Living in a small apartment, this will inspire me to grow the business to eventually serve in a larger capacity. I'm so overjoyed because I know this can happen.  This can be a worldwide change for woman and eventually men who will be able to afford handbags, wallets, briefcases, luggage, doggy carriers, etc. at a miminal cost and look like a million dollars.

Contributions can be small, I will appreiciate anything.  Even if the goal is not met, the funds received will start my business.  I just need a chance to make a difference. 

Please be patient, I do not have a video camera to show a video, nor do I have the latest and greatest computer, not yet, but with your help, it can and will happen.

If funding a $1.00 contribution is not of your interest, please share this aritcle with others who may want to assist me.  When 500 people contribute $1.00 each, my goal will be accomplished.

I am trusting in faith that people will help.  Just because I have a disability does not mean I can't make a difference in the world of fashion. 

(No "fake" or "knock-offs" ever sold) Thank you

Please watch for future "perks" once this campaign starts rolling.

story:
Famed watch designer, Emmanuel Gueit, works for the best. Aged 25 he transformed the Royal Oak into the Offshore Chrono, one of the masterpieces of the last century.
When it came to re-designing the dials of another masterpiece, Emmanuel Gueit was the obvious choice.
story_txt:
Chronopods dials


 
 
 Famed watch designer, Emmanuel Gueit, works for the best. Aged 25 he transformed the Royal Oak into the Offshore Chrono, one of the masterpieces of the last century.When it came to re-designing the dials of another masterpiece, Emmanuel Gueit was the obvious choice.

story:
Your Personal Place in Space  

This is our 4th SpaceTime Coordinates project! If you missed our previous campaigns, come check SpaceTimeCoordinates.com. 

Commemorate a birth, wedding, first kiss or the moon landing! Every date in history has a different and unique planetary alignment. This is not a simple gizmo, but a precise depiction of the Solar System. Take a moment to meditate on the significance of life itself and our place in space

 

 

Custom Made with Science & Lasers

This new collection of Mementos is laser cut and engraved, and this technique brings new materials we are very excited about: Acrylic and Wood!

Our designs are the most precise and accurate on the market because we rely on the same data that is used by NASA to predict eclipses or to compute spacecraft trajectories.

We can calculate the precise position of each planet on its orbital path, given any particular date in time. In fact, our Orrery is so accurate, it has been featured by OpenNASA!

The four dimensions (x, y, z, and t) are used to represent a particular location in time and space, also known as the 4th dimension, which might come handy if you ever stumble upon a wormhole or a tear in the fabric of the Universe.

 

Materials

Acrylic

Acrylic is hard and stiff as plastics go. It is sensitive to stress concentrations sharing a certain fragility with glass. Available in Fluoro Blue or Clear Green. Acrylic is non-toxic and recyclable in some areas.

 

Walnut

Walnut Premium Veneer has an MDF core with real wood veneer (thin slice of wood) on each side which is sanded smooth and finished with a clear coat. It has a high-grade appearance, the grain direction will change the overall appearance depending on the light direction.

 

Bamboo

Bamboo is a material with natural variation, such as lighter or darker wood grain. The Bamboo sheet is made of five layers of veneer (thin slice of wood). Bamboo is 100% renewable and sustainable.

 

Philosophy

The STC project is about celebrating humanity, its achievements and ingenuity. It helps us relate to the Solar System itself and find our own place in the universe.

And to contextualize our human history and individual lives within the bigger picture of the universe.

 

The goal is to put things into perspective, in taking a moment to appreciate the human condition, nature, space, life. Take a breath. Contemplate.

Our time on Earth and within the universe might well be a tiny blip on the grand scale of time and space, but we should celebrate our humanity nonetheless.

No matter how ephemeral human life is, or for that matter, our personal lives. We have the obligation to always reach for the stars; keep on exploring, learning and creating.

We have the duty to survive and prosper.

 

Awards

 

Team

 

Follow us
story_txt:
Your Personal Place in Space  
This is our 4th SpaceTime Coordinates project! If you missed our previous campaigns, come check SpaceTimeCoordinates.com. Commemorate a birth, wedding, first kiss or the moon landing! Every date in history has a different and unique planetary alignment. This is not a simple gizmo, but a precise depiction of the Solar System. Take a moment to meditate on the significance of life itself and our place in space 


 

Custom Made with Science & Lasers

This new collection of Mementos is laser cut and engraved, and this technique brings new materials we are very excited about: Acrylic and Wood!
Our designs are the most precise and accurate on the market because we rely on the same data that is used by NASA to predict eclipses or to compute spacecraft trajectories.
We can calculate the precise position of each planet on its orbital path, given any particular date in time. In fact, our Orrery is so accurate, it has been featured by OpenNASA!
The four dimensions (x, y, z, and t) are used to represent a particular location in time and space, also known as the 4th dimension, which might come handy if you ever stumble upon a wormhole or a tear in the fabric of the Universe.

 
Materials
Acrylic
Acrylic is hard and stiff as plastics go. It is sensitive to stress concentrations sharing a certain fragility with glass. Available in Fluoro Blue or Clear Green. Acrylic is non-toxic and recyclable in some areas.

 
Walnut
Walnut Premium Veneer has an MDF core with real wood veneer (thin slice of wood) on each side which is sanded smooth and finished with a clear coat. It has a high-grade appearance, the grain direction will change the overall appearance depending on the light direction. 
 
Bamboo
Bamboo is a material with natural variation, such as lighter or darker wood grain. The Bamboo sheet is made of five layers of veneer (thin slice of wood). Bamboo is 100% renewable and sustainable.

And to contextualize our human history and individual lives within the bigger picture of the universe.  
The goal is to put things into perspective, in taking a moment to appreciate the human condition, nature, space, life. Take a breath. Contemplate.
Our time on Earth and within the universe might well be a tiny blip on the grand scale of time and space, but we should celebrate our humanity nonetheless.
No matter how ephemeral human life is, or for that matter, our personal lives. We have the obligation to always reach for the stars; keep on exploring, learning and creating.
We have the duty to survive and prosper.

story:
Introduction to YELO- Prayas Innovation

Prayas is a international social enterprise, empowering students and rural household with basic educational infrastructure to study efficiently and live a better living.

Prayas Innovation, a company founded with a vision to address the challenges faced by society in areas of energy, education and health.

    The Impact

    Students in rural areas, lack access to basic educational infrastructure. As basic as a desk, a bag, a light source to study at night. 91 million students world wide lack access to education.Most of the students in rural part of the world and some in urban as well have to sit down on floor for long studying hours. 9 in 10 people face posture related problems and back injuries at some point of time in their life. Sitting on floor and studying for 6-8 hours affects posture, resulting in back pain, poor eye sight, inefficiency to concentrate and study. 

    Rural areas in mostly all the countries face power cuts for several hours. Generally people are habituated to not having access to electricity. 1 in 3 people across the globe lack access to electricity. For households to perform their daily task and for children to study at night, fossil fuel (kerosene / cow dung) is used to create a light source. Mother’s use this light to cook and perform daily tasks, while children use this light source to play, little do they know that the burning biomass fuel can cause death. There are a little more than 500000 deaths in India alone every year due to inhalation of the flames caused by burning biomass. Lacking access to light source forces the children to study in hazardous environment. 


    Solution:

    YELO, an intelligently designed school bag, helps children carry their books, belonging, irrespective of the weather conditions. The same bag with a single fold technique smartly transforms into a school desk. The desk offers and angle of 30- 35 degrees for students to write and read, thus ensuring they maintain an ergonomic posture while studying.


    1 in 3 people across the globe lack access to electricity. Remote areas face heavy power cuts, thereby making it difficult for children to study at night. Yelo is built with a LED light source, to delivering light for more than 6-8 hours, thus empowering students and rural household to carry out their evening chores.


    Yelo comes with a handy solar kit that powers the LED light. The rechargeable battery in solar kit can be charged through solar energy as well as supports AC charging. Solar kit can also be used for other application like charging mobile phones in case of emergency.

    What we Need & What You Get

    We need your support to implement YELO at schools in rural areas of third world countries. We have started distribution of free samples in rural villages of India. 

    Help us reach our funding goal in order to manufacture and implement samples in rural areas of Rajasthan. We have interesting perks for the support you are to offer for lighting the lives of millions across the globe.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Help us to spread the awareness about the cause by sharing our campaign on social media platform.

story:
Sadly, the ocean is in bad condition.

BETWEEN 8-10 MILLION TONS OF PLASTIC ENTER THE OCEAN EVERY YEAR.

Photo was taken by NOAA 

OVER 5 TRILLION PIECES OF PLASTIC CURRENTLY LITTER THE OCEAN.

 As the trash circulates, it collects in the currents of the ocean and builds into large patches. The largest is the Great Pacific Garbage Patch which sits in the Pacific between California and Hawaii. It currently is about twice the size as the state of Texas.

Photo From The Ocean Cleanup

This is a big issue.

300,000 DOLPHINS DIE EVERY YEAR DUE TO OCEAN TRASH.

Photo Taken by Nick Gruen

When we first discovered this issue and recognized the intensity of this problem it pulled at our heartstrings. When looking at the size of this issue it was easy to feel powerless. That is until we came across an amazing Non-Profit called The Ocean Cleanup.

Photos Taken by National Geographic

The Ocean Cleanup develops advanced technologies to rid the world’s ocean of plastic. A full-scale deployment of their systems is estimated to clean up 50% of the Great Pacific Garbage Patch in 5 years. 

Photo from The Ocean Cleanup

There are many voices in the world declaring that the difference only one person can make is slim. But we beg to differ. Even though the challenges this world is facing are increasingly difficult to tackle, each one of us can make a difference in the steps for social change.

We designed a Blue Stone Line of Wire Wrapped Rings with the vision to clean our oceans and promote social change.

Each ring is handmade with tarnish resistant silver wire wrapped around ocean blue stones. 

Each blue ring represents the idea that, “we are not just a drop in the ocean, but rather, the entire ocean in a single drop” -Rumi. This quote is our motto and what we standby as a company.

Our goals will allow us to be able to tackle the plastic in the ocean, stop the plastic generation at the source, and inspire others to take a stand and join the vision of a better world.


Our rings are different than the others. Not only are they simple and easy to wear, but they also stand by the cause of cleaning ocean pollution. We hope that everyone who wears them will be reminded to be the “entire ocean in a single drop”. Our customers will love wearing their handmade, unique rings that inspire change.

Each of our blue-stone, wire wrapped rings are made by hand. When we make and wear these rings we are reminded of our love for the ocean. When sending out the rings we send our love, passion, and gratitude to each of our supporters. 

"Let's be a part of the largest cleanup in history." -The Ocean Cleanup 2017

Photo Taken by Annie Ritter-Jones

We are aiming to raise $1000 but are not limiting our goal to that. Your support is what will make a difference in how much we are able to donate. We will be happy donating anything we can to The Ocean Cleanup and their immense efforts to save our oceans.

The Impact

As we previously mentioned, small actions make a big difference. Can you imagine over 8 MILLION TONS of plastic waste entering our oceans every year?

Photo From The Ocean Cleanup 

This issue will not disappear on its own, that is why we need YOU to give a drop of yourself to make a difference. ​

We want every person to understand the importance of preserving the ocean. We were ecstatic to find ways to make an impact. We know that you will feel the same way as you join the cause to preserve our ocean. 

We are grateful for each and everything our supporters do to help the project. YOU truly are important to us and this cause. Sometimes we may never come to see the impact of our small actions, but we hope to inspire people to believe that it is through our small, daily actions that great changes are made. We thank you from the bottoms of our heart for all of your support.

Risks & Challenges

1. Our goal is not to make a profit. Our love and passion are in the ocean, and we want to do whatever we can to make a difference. We realize that it is our small “drops” that when united together will be able to make a big contribution to The Ocean Cleanup. The magnitude of the impact we make is up to you. 

We are aiming to raise $1000. Our aim is to make a difference rather than to earn a profit, because of this, 40% of profits will go toward production costs and 60% will be donated to funding the Ocean Cleanup. Whether our $1000 goal is met or not, we will donate 60% of our profits to the Ocean Cleanup. We will be happy donating anything we can to them and their immense efforts to save our oceans.

2. Another challenge that we predict is the production. We will be hand making each ring and so as the demand increases our ability to produce will be slowed. We will do everything in our power to get the production out. We will train extra volunteers to help with production and shipment. These make amazing Christmas packages, so we want everyone to get what they need before the holidays.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • It takes one drop to start a waterfall! We hope that this campaign will inspire you to take action. The more drops that join together, the more impact we can make. Please share with your friends and family. 

  • This is our world to live in, so let's take care of it! Recycle, clean up the litter you see, and spread the word.

  • Go to https://www.theoceancleanup.com/ to find out other ways to help you can get involved.

 

Timeline

Meet Our Team

Background

Alexa- Alexa is studying Business Management with an emphasis in Marketing at Brigham Young University Hawaii. She can always be found wearing rings on almost every finger. She is kind, intelligent, and always ready for a good time. She enjoys going to the beach, whether it be to spend time in the sun with friends, alone to sit, swim, and clear her head, or to watch the sunset. She loves the ocean because of its endless beauty.

Saren- Saren is studying Intercultural Peacebuilding with a Minor in Entrepreneurship at Brigham Young University Hawaii. She is creative, adventurous, and dedicated to making a difference in the world. She is the owner of a small jewelry company called Woven Jewel where she makes wire wrapped rings and necklaces. She is the designer behind The Drop Project. She holds deep to her heart the idea that, "we are not just a drop in the ocean, but an entire ocean in a single drop".

Sandy- Sandy is studying Business Management Finance with a Minor in Entrepreneurship at Brigham Young University Hawaii. She is sweet, hardworking, and service oriented. She loves accessories, especially rings. She enjoys spending her personal time reading at the beach. She finds joy in cleaning our oceans.

story:
It integrates art and technology into a very versatile device that mesmerizes anyone who sees it.  

  

 

The LED Mask transcribes any sort of music and any type of rhythm into amazing Illuminations.  

 

 

Our masks are easily wearable, foldable and adjustable. As a costume or music accessory for any occasion, they are the perfect companion.   

 

 

After successfully completing our first Kickstarter campaign we are proud to introduce to you our new collection.    

Help to spread the word about The Sound Reactive LED Masks by Outline Montréal. Hit one of the buttons below!  

 

 

 

    

    

    

The LED Mask* is powered by phosphorus ink paired with a lithium modulator. OK, but what’s phosphorus ink? A material that consumes minimal power, is cold to the touch and emits a very captivating glow. This is the same technology that is used in watches to light the faces. The modulator converts the sound waves into programmed patterns creating pure organic light.     

  • Sound responsive lithium modulator - Our most advanced piece of technology. The modulator is powered by a lithium-ion battery (DC5V). It is much smaller and lighter than our previous one, cutting the overall weight of the mask in half.
  • Adjustable straps - The straps are easy to set up and fits any head size.
  • Hidden cable - The cable is now completely hidden inside the strap. 
  • Protective foam - A 1mm piece of high-density foam, protects the mask while being comfortable to wear.
  • Phosphorus layer - Phosphorus ink screen printed on a translucent conductor. 
  • Printed design - High quality printed colors applied on a PWB layer. 
  • Weight - 80 g / 2.82 oz

* patent pending

The LED mask is a companion that you can bring with you anytime or anywhere there’s music. It is lightweight, malleable and can easily fit in your pocket or bag. Wear it and you will become instantly part of the sensation. During your private parties, festivals or even displayed in your living room - this mask suits any setting.   

    

    

 

    

The brilliant designs of our collaborators Patrick Seymour and BÜRO UFHO, supported by the valuable feedback of our community, inspired this collection. These eight new designs are the result of incredible teamwork. Now that you know everything about it, which LED Mask do you feel best describes your own style?   

    

    

    

    

    

    

    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  How to power-up your LED Mask?   

Just press the button located behind your head and it’s on.     

To adjust the mask’s sensitivity, turn the wheel on the side.     

We improved the global structure of the mask by relocating the modulator - now located on the back of your head. The cable, connecting the modulator to the mask, is integrated and hidden within the adjustable strap giving you total comfort and mobility.   

As noted by our backers, when the source of the sound was too close or too loud, the mask did not properly capture the beat of the music. We worked on the modulator and we significantly upgraded its sensitivity to better decipher the rhythm with minimal interference.   

    

    

    

We are a team of creative entrepreneurs from Montréal with a strong interest in art and music. Fascinated by masked artists, we always believed that people express themselves differently when disguised. The idea of identity vanishes and the real you rises when wearing a mask.    

Two years ago you supported our vision to make our first sound reactive LED Mask.The Kickstarter community and our early adopters believed in us before anyone else even knew we existed. 

After the first campaign, our team grew from three to six members, totally dedicating ourselves to the electro-luminescent technology. Now we need your help to bring our company further and create new masks with worldwide artists.

We have our working prototypes, but demand for our products is constantly growing and we need a better way to get you our masks. With your help, we can start the production of our final products and make sure everything runs as seamlessly as possible.

Your help will go directly into further improving our technology, make new collaborations and bring even more designs to life. 

 

 

 

 

 

     

 

    

 

You can get in touch with us, using Indigogo’s messaging service, Messenger or via email at contact@outline-montreal.com. Our team will be available around the clock to respond to any questions or feedback.  

Is shipping included?

  • USA / Canada: US$ 5
  • Worldwide: US$ 8
  • Free Shipping worldwide starting at 4 Masks

 

Spread the word about this project, and let us bring even more designs to reality!

story:
By cutting out wholesalers, distributors, and retailers we can sell products with the same quality of major name brands without the luxury markup. By producing the handbags ourselves and selling them directly to you, the customers we do not have to pay a commission to all of these parties and therefore can pass on all of the savings to you. 

                                

The Collection

 

 

Our Mission 

Our mission at Dajana Rodriguez is to bring high end European leather handbags a fraction of the price when compared to worldwide brands. Since we produce all of our own items is easy for us to pass on the savings to our customers. We can cut out the wholesaler's distributor's and retailer's and provide the products of the same quality without the excessive mark up.

Our Story

With the help of skilled craftsman that work for us, we now produce and sell handbags around the world. We are continuing in our countries tradition of creating embroidered leather products. Everything we create is original and unique. Every new design is different from the previous one and we devote absolute attention and care to each one. Our culture and natural beauty influence our creations and designs. We offer classic and timeless pieces that are unique and one-of-a-kind.  

 

 

The inspiration for The Heart of Europe

 

Production 

 

Dimensions 

Pricing

Follow us on Social Media and help get the word out about Dajana Rodriguez

 

 https://www.facebook.com/DajanaRodriguezHandbags

 https://www.instagram.com/dajanarodriguez/

 

Join our revolution by backing this project and claiming your high end luxury handbag for a fraction of the price when compared to major luxury brands. 

Dajana Rodriguez has been on the market for 6 years not with thousand of satisfied customers. This is why we have decided to go with a flexible funding goal since we are functioning brand that can fulfill any amount of orders 

 

Risks & Challenges

There are a few risks and challenges associated with the production of any kind of item. We are limited to a certain degree by our suppliers of leather and various components that we use to produce our handbags. We will do everything in our power to ensure that we place orders with all of our suppliers to correspond with the amount of orders we receive. 

The fact that we have been on the market for 6 years has allowed us develop relationships with producers and distributors of all necessary components which will play a vital role in obtaining all supplies necessary. 

Lastly one risk associated with producing high end handbags is that we produce every single product ourselves. We do not have any producers and therefore some delays may occur in shipment due to the fact that real people will be fulfilling every order and not automated machines.
story_txt:
By cutting out wholesalers, distributors, and retailers we can sell products with the same quality of major name brands without the luxury markup. By producing the handbags ourselves and selling them directly to you, the customers we do not have to pay a commission to all of these parties and therefore can pass on all of the savings to you. 
                                
The Collection

 

 
Our Mission 
Our mission at Dajana Rodriguez is to bring high end European leather handbags a fraction of the price when compared to worldwide brands. Since we produce all of our own items is easy for us to pass on the savings to our customers. We can cut out the wholesaler's distributor's and retailer's and provide the products of the same quality without the excessive mark up.

Our Story
With the help of skilled craftsman that work for us, we now produce and sell handbags around the world. We are continuing in our countries tradition of creating embroidered leather products. Everything we create is original and unique. Every new design is different from the previous one and we devote absolute attention and care to each one. Our culture and natural beauty influence our creations and designs. We offer classic and timeless pieces that are unique and one-of-a-kind.  
 


 
The inspiration for The Heart of Europe

story:
WHAT IS LOOKMINDERS?

The web outfits-photo sharing app, with unique mechanism by which before exploring the content, you indicate what you are wearing at the current moment. It makes your clothes-photos getting attention on daily basis, exactly as in real life. Also you see what is currently being worn on the planet, not what has been recently uplaoded.

WHY TO SHARE OUTFIT PHOTO?

We probably do not have to convince you...but if yes, then think over if you are catching yourself as finding the way for glancing at the various glass surfaces - like on this video

There is a peacock inside each of us. We are not fashion victims but we mind a look. We put an effort to buy the clothes which suit us, to wear them properly. Would be great to exhibit it widely.

(seeing outfit photos of others is also an extreme fun)

VIDEO

  • IT IS NOT ABOUT MONEY, IT IS ABOUT APPRECIATION - WE DO THINGS FOR FREE!

Most of the scenes of the video above were captured with mobile phone camera.

To make professional video is not a big cost comparing to development app, but we had doubts if to put our money for recording professional video. It would cost us about 300-400$ for recording & professional video editing, and at current moment, we are in the point, where each dollar counts...

But...if we see that you like the idea, it will be a great motivation for us to spend such money and do so. The movie will be explaining Lookminders idea by the same scenario so hands & table, but much better captured [we will rent an HD camera]  & edited [we will hire a professionalist to do it] . Also with much better spokesman ;) without the crowdfudning part. 

How you can help us? Just click on any of the appreciation button (facebook like, tweet google plus) in the bottom of the video located "Share this campaign". If we get 500 in total for all the counters (fb, tweet, g+) by 10th of January, we will record the HQ vid, just because we will get that some of you like the idea!

To confirm - this goal is not connected with money. We can have 0$ raised for project, but if there is 500 in total of all counters, we will record a movie, by end of January! Try us - it costs you nothing.

  • FEATHERS 

In the video there is disruption of voice at. Thats because in original version we have recorded it with wrong pronounciation. So now we are smarter. We know how to pronounce that. For ever. Here it goes: http://www.forvo.com/word/feather/

STORY SO FAR - WHAT HAS BEEN DONE

Lookminders idea was born in 2011. 

First of all was the web app, the fully-featured & working Lookminders app and the technical basis of the planned mobile apps. Most of development of it has happened in the 2nd half of 2012 and has been finalised early 2013. 

The cost (development, logo & interface desing, infrastructure) was covered from the founder's private savings. 

Unfotunately curently I am not able to do the same with mobile apps - we ve run out of money.

Of course there are thing to be improved, but for current moment we need to focus on...

WHAT IS NEXT? - THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT


The goal is the launch the mobile apps of Lookminders for two main platforms - Android & iOs devices. The fact that Lookminders is an photo-sharing app, makes sure that it wil benefit a lot from launching mobile-instance.

The app will be almost fully featured, means it will allow:

- user sign up

- indicating current outfit ("putting on" your clothes) - by drag & drop feature, so you ll feel like taking your clothes off from the hanger!


- exploring & interacting others' outfits


- reviewing action history ("my taste")

what will be not available in mobile instance from the moment of first release are:

  • account settings managment - password reset, email address setting etc. It will be introduced in future
  • multi-language serving, so it will be in english only

What is important, that some of the things have been already done! We have:

  • basic layout design for all the screens, but it needs a shaping for sure
  • developed webservices for mobile-app to server communication

So what is still be done, is pure android & iOs development + layout polishing.

Total estimated fund we need for this is 6000$. This will be mostly spent on external Android & iOs developers, who will produce the code and smaller part for graphic designer.

Estimated time of delivery is March of 2014 for the android app and April 2014 for the iOs app - beta version available for public. We ve already introduced all the requirements & technical documentation to the mentioend mobile-developers. We need about 2 months per platform, but for some period two jobs can go paralelly.

IMPORTANT: the project may be posted on various crowd-funding platforms. thats why we are pledging less on each, not the total amount which is needed. 
Upcoming weeks we will be posting an updates about current status of ongoing campaigns over the our social media pages.

OUR PERKS

Let us introduce what you can get...

Hand-written thank you letter - 6$

Standard thanks are also long-lasting, but having it paper-stated makes it nice memento of the fact that you helped us. Have it hand-written on Lookminders paper - signed by the founder. Please indicate what is the recipient name in case if different than in shipping address.

Lookminders stickers - 12$

Get 3 pairs of Lookminders glossy paper stickers, about 9x4cm sized with Lookminders logo & slogans. 3 slogans included, harcoded sequence: SPREAD FEATHERS - SHOW ONLINE - SHINE BRIGHT

Lookminders shoe brush - 25$


Let us take a part in making you shining bright. Wooden, with light-beige coloured hair, handy sized (12cm long). Fortune begins at clean shoes, they said.

Lookminders promoted photos section appearance - 60$

Let your outfits spread the world. You select a photo of you in clothes and we put it on our main page Promoted section (it appears for signed in users us well). You will be seen by mil...hmm hundreds of users daily. The place is yours for one month, druing which you can stay with one photo there, or we will be chaning it according to what you are wearing and ve put on, if you decide to use Lookminders.

Your outfit as a brand of Lookminders mobile app - 250$

One photo of your outfit will be shown on the screen of iphone/android phone wherever it appears in any kind of materials - any kind of landing pages, mockups, app store info, banners. This place is branded by you, means you are getting it FOREVER!


Mug - 3000$

Yes, this is special. You wonder for how much we would sell out, and we wonder where is the border to cross, where is the limit in making the dream come true. What is worth to be sacrified for lucrative sponsorship deal - renaming your headquater or adding something to brand name? At this moment of Lookminders story, fortunately we are free of such considerations. But we can offer you a mug. 

This mug has been given to me, the founder, for my birthday last year. The gift was from my best friends and it was to convince me to stay with the idea and to make it happen, in time when I had a lot of doubts if Lookminders is worth to be still developed. The mug has also appeared in our video.

This mug is extremly important for me, I have been using it for half a year, and now I am deciding to sell it so it is like selling part of my soul.

Mug is signed on the bottom by my friends. I will pack it very special way to be safety delivered and will prove it authenticity be recording a movie especially for you. I can also announce your name trough the Lookminders social media pages, if you like. Keep in mind, that it maybe very precious item in the future. 

You can treat it as puting us on test, or as an investment, or both.

The deal is simple - you get the mug & part of founder's soul, we get a big part of what we need.

story:
We created SILA with the ambition to bring something new to the feminine watch market. SILA isn't just another men's watch adapted for women. It's a watch with women in mind: feminine, creative, colorful and chic. 

The SILA jewel mini-watch will match your every style and it will soon become your favorite fashion accessory ! 

 

Why choose one when you can have them all? SILA is one watch with 20 different looks.

SILA will unleash the potential of your wardrobe, offering you a wide choice of interchangeable straps in gorgeous colors.

 

Inspired by vintage women's watches, we designed a watch that would perfectly fit a woman's wrist and her jewelry. Fall in love with its mini precious size. A true jewel-watch, a new addiction. 

SILA watches fit all wrist sizes

 

Twist your look with a quick click! We've invented a smart new way to easily change your strap. 

Go from day to night, the office to a dinner party, by upping your day outfit to an evening game with a quick click.

The SILA watch comes in three metal colors: silver, gold and rose gold. You can choose between 23 colors of straps and 2 strap materials: Jewelry Chain and Waxed Enhanced Cotton. 

We have teamed up with renowned watchmakers with decades of experience. We are so confident with the quality of our watch, that each of our timepieces comes with a 2-year guarantee.

To go with your SILA watch, because we, women, just LOVE to layer bracelets, we have designed the ideal bangle bracelet that would perfectly echo and match your watch. It's feminine, sophisticated yet minimalistic. Get the full look!

 

Note that in the reward table above, the full watch always comes with a waxed cotton strap and the additional watch straps are in waxed cotton. 

 

 

 

 

Follow us and help us spread the word by sharing our campaign with your friends!

 

SILA stands for "Sorry I'm late Again". Reminds you of anyone? 

Our brand is for all women, from the go-getters to the yogis, planners to daydreamers, who live their life to the fullest, and always, have a good reason to be late! 

Share your own stories by using #SILA #SorryImLateAgain. The best picture wins a free watch.

 

 

E-mail us at hello@sila-paris.com

story:
As a child growing up outside of Boston, I remember struggling with the decision of whether to become a veterinarian or an artist. Career day in the second grade was quite a defining moment. This was a very difficult decision for a 7 year old, but one I finally made upon learning about the amount of math and science involved in becoming a Doctor of Veterinary Medicine. Thus I became a designer. Some years passed (20 or so) before I discovered a way to merge my two passions, but once I did, I knew I would never look back. 

I started my own company after ten years in the jewelry industry in New York City. I watched many companies struggle to stay afloat by pushing Chinese factory workers as well as their own employees in the States to work beyond reasonable hours, using toxic products, and polluting the environment. I decided that I wanted to do things differently. I wanted to start a company that agreed with my values. Dana Young Jewelry's products are all made in the USA, with as much recycled metal as possible. The only overtime is my own and I contribute 10% of the company profits to animal welfare organizations. 





 

If you wish to help in a way other than financially OR you are desperate to see one of these stretch goals come to fruition OR you just think someone you know might need a piece of Dana Young Jewelry, please share this project with your friends.

story:
TailTalker was born while crossing a railroad track looking at the hitch receiver on the truck in front of me as it went high enough to see the whole assembly underneath.  I was making up "political" bumper stickers in my head trying to think of a catchy way to get more attention.  I started thinking about the $335 hitch receiver I had just installed on my truck and how it probably wouldn't be used 1% of the time after all that money I had  spent on it.

     Then it hit me...we could use the hitch receiver 100% of it's life and the associated running lights, brake lights and turn signal lighting circuits that come with it to "light up" my bumper sticker so it could be seen day or night, even in foggy or snowy conditions.  My mind started racing as I thought about a safety hitch cover with the LED lights grabbing all motorist attention for your presence or turning/braking intentions.  TheTailTalker would make those behind you always be aware of you...and even better, read your bumper sticker.

     That was in 2010 that the patent search, the prototype build and the "real world" R & D began.  The initial TailTalker (my wife named it), was a stamped metal tray, 28" x 4" with a plastic receiver tube screwed on and 4-1157 duel element tail light bulbs in 4 holes (2 on each side) and a red translucent lens with a GEORGIA BULLDOGS vinyl stencil covering the 4" x 28" frame.  Example below, bottom white metal w/1157 bulbs.

 (PHOTO ABOVE; 1ST, 2ND, and 3RD PROGRESSIONS OF TAILTALKER)             

It was just what I wanted with running lights showing everybody behind me Georgia Bulldogs in the night.  Even in the daylight my right turn would flash a bright red Bulldogs, Bulldogs, Bulldogs and the left turn flashed Georgia, Georgia, Georgia.  Then I'd hit my brakes to show the whole world a brilliant red Georgia Bulldogs.  I finally had my obnoxious, attention getting Georgia Bulldogs illuminated bumper sticker.

     The patent process, prototype build and the R & D are interrelated as developing ideas for improvement demand rewriting and change.  Here is a diamond plate step model with a new LED light that didn't work.  

(PHOTO ABOVE; 1ST STEP MODEL w/RED LED's.  DIDN'T WORK.) 

Experimenting with different materials, adhesives, light designs and all the people that are experts with these items is exciting and rewarding.  FUNNY, everyone sees the TailTalker and immediately suggests a "smart phone" programable message you could change (on the fly) but the DOT considers that a "distraction" and is ILLEGAL.  The R & D is not for the faint of heart.  Spending 4 hours to put something together, only to have it shake apart in the first 2 miles can be discouraging.  

(PHOTO ABOVE; 3 DIFFERENT LED LIGHT TRIALS)

The TailTalker has been destroyed and pieces of some of the first derivations are scattered on roads all over Atlanta.  The TailTalker is not indestructible but is designed and tested to take a lot of abuse.

     The funding I'm seeking is to afford efficiencies of scale.  

          A.  We have a 1st run of 300 TailTalkers in production now that will be used for rewards but the manufacturing process was slow and expensive.  These will be complete and ready to ship in July, 2014.

          B.  The LED lights we install utilize about 98 lites per unit so we need to order by May to receive in 6 weeks to fulfill 3000 TailTalkers by July 30th for reward shipment.  

          C.  The wiring harnesses are soldered, wired, labeled and shipped to an assembly line where we will employ the disabled veterans to assemble the components for shipping.  This sub-contractor is in place.

  (COIL CORD {no one has} OLD LED lite strips & HAND WIRED)

        D.  The injection molding of the lens frame (injection mold costs $25,000) produces the best parts cheaper and faster. The mold is a high cost item that could take 6-8 weeks to machine.  This is a crucial step but our CAD files are ready to select the mold maker and here your funds make or break this plan.

  (INJECTION MOLDED PARTS W/OLD LITE STRIPS, TEMPORARY WIRING)        

E.  Although our present office is based near Atlanta, Georgia where we assemble TailTalkers now by hand.  A facility search may yield savings or tax credits for bringing new employment and light manufacturing to a particularly depressed area.  Your funding will provide mass production of the TailTalker  with a retail price of $35 - $50. 

  •          GOAL; This auto accessory will take 30,000,000 seldom used $300 - $400 hitch receivers and make them useful 100% of the time for safety and messaging. You, as a sponsor, could be the first to show others the potential of this device and take huge satisfaction and pride knowing you promoted new employment, manufacturing and all those TailTalkers you see as you are driving down the highway.  Please join me.

EXAMPLES OF SOME REWARDS FOR PLEDGES

FINISHED TAILTALKERS & CUSTOM MESSAGES
story_txt:
TailTalker was born while crossing a railroad track looking at the hitch receiver on the truck in front of me as it went high enough to see the whole assembly underneath.  I was making up "political" bumper stickers in my head trying to think of a catchy way to get more attention.  I started thinking about the $335 hitch receiver I had just installed on my truck and how it probably wouldn't be used 1% of the time after all that money I had  spent on it.     Then it hit me...we could use the hitch receiver 100% of it's life and the associated running lights, brake lights and turn signal lighting circuits that come with it to "light up" my bumper sticker so it could be seen day or night, even in foggy or snowy conditions.  My mind started racing as I thought about a safety hitch cover with the LED lights grabbing all motorist attention for your presence or turning/braking intentions.  TheTailTalker would make those behind you always be aware of you...and even better, read your bumper sticker.     That was in 2010 that the patent search, the prototype build and the "real world" R & D began.  The initial TailTalker (my wife named it), was a stamped metal tray, 28" x 4" with a plastic receiver tube screwed on and 4-1157 duel element tail light bulbs in 4 holes (2 on each side) and a red translucent lens with a GEORGIA BULLDOGS vinyl stencil covering the 4" x 28" frame.  Example below, bottom white metal w/1157 bulbs.1st, 2nd, and 3rd progressions w/TailTalker (PHOTO ABOVE; 1ST, 2ND, and 3RD PROGRESSIONS OF TAILTALKER)             It was just what I wanted with running lights showing everybody behind me Georgia Bulldogs in the night.  Even in the daylight my right turn would flash a bright red Bulldogs, Bulldogs, Bulldogs and the left turn flashed Georgia, Georgia, Georgia.  Then I'd hit my brakes to show the whole world a brilliant red Georgia Bulldogs.  I finally had my obnoxious, attention getting Georgia Bulldogs illuminated bumper sticker.     The patent process, prototype build and the R & D are interrelated as developing ideas for improvement demand rewriting and change.  Here is a diamond plate step model with a new LED light that didn't work.  Step model w/red LED's.  Didn't work but gave us the start on ALL-METAL TT(PHOTO ABOVE; 1ST STEP MODEL w/RED LED's.  DIDN'T WORK.) Experimenting with different materials, adhesives, light designs and all the people that are experts with these items is exciting and rewarding.  FUNNY, everyone sees the TailTalker and immediately suggests a "smart phone" programable message you could change (on the fly) but the DOT considers that a "distraction" and is ILLEGAL.  The R & D is not for the faint of heart.  Spending 4 hours to put something together, only to have it shake apart in the first 2 miles can be discouraging.  (3 different LED trials)(PHOTO ABOVE; 3 DIFFERENT LED LIGHT TRIALS)The TailTalker has been destroyed and pieces of some of the first derivations are scattered on roads all over Atlanta.  The TailTalker is not indestructible but is designed and tested to take a lot of abuse.     The funding I'm seeking is to afford efficiencies of scale.            A.  We have a 1st run of 300 TailTalkers in production now that will be used for rewards but the manufacturing process was slow and expensive.  These will be complete and ready to ship in July, 2014.          B.  The LED lights we install utilize about 98 lites per unit so we need to order by May to receive in 6 weeks to fulfill 3000 TailTalkers by July 30th for reward shipment.            C.  The wiring harnesses are soldered, wired, labeled and shipped to an assembly line where we will employ the disabled veterans to assemble the components for shipping.  This sub-contractor is in place.Coil cord (no one has) old LEDs & hand wired  (COIL CORD {no one has} OLD LED lite strips & HAND WIRED)        D.  The injection molding of the lens frame (injection mold costs $25,000) produces the best parts cheaper and faster. The mold is a high cost item that could take 6-8 weeks to machine.  This is a crucial step but our CAD files are ready to select the mold maker and here your funds make or break this plan.These parts injection molded NOTE: old LED Lites that DIDN'T WORK  (INJECTION MOLDED PARTS W/OLD LITE STRIPS, TEMPORARY WIRING)        E.  Although our present office is based near Atlanta, Georgia where we assemble TailTalkers now by hand.  A facility search may yield savings or tax credits for bringing new employment and light manufacturing to a particularly depressed area.  Your funding will provide mass production of the TailTalker  with a retail price of $35 - $50.          GOAL; This auto accessory will take 30,000,000 seldom used $300 - $400 hitch receivers and make them useful 100% of the time for safety and messaging. You, as a sponsor, could be the first to show others the potential of this device and take huge satisfaction and pride knowing you promoted new employment, manufacturing and all those TailTalkers you see as you are driving down the highway.  Please join me.EXAMPLES OF SOME REWARDS FOR PLEDGES

FINISHED TAILTALKERS & CUSTOM MESSAGES

story:
Short Summary

Hello - Thank you for checking out our IndieGogo project! D'Marie is a fiesty start-up with a clear goal to not just change existing e-commerce infrastructure systems, but replace them completely. However, we now need your financial support to complete our next step; the D'Marie mobile app! 

Allow me to give you a bit of background on the company. D'Marie was first incorporated in NYC about 18 months ago. Our team's background in fashion spans from casting New York Fashion Week to producing fashion photoshoots for top clothing brands. Our vast experience led us to understand that in order to solve the consumer question "Where can I buy that?", we had to tackle a larger industry issue. It's no secret that the fashion and tech industries have never been in sync with one another. If you think about it, the evolution of the internet and e-commerce came after the industry was already using brick and mortar distribution methods via boutiques and large department stores. Ever since the internet and social media came along, it has been a scramble for designers and industry members to replace outdated processes with new technical solutions. Alright, enough with the history lesson... onto the reason you're here!

D'Marie's moble app will enable you, the shopper, to do the following:

(*Images above are not finalized product)

- Search and shop any garment seen in a television show, advertisement, editorial, film, music video, red carpet image or celebrity press photo. Once we identify the image you were looking for, we'll connect you directly to the retailer where you can make the purchase!

- Walk into any participating retail store, scan an item's tag and view an entire "IMBD-esque" history of where in media the garment or accessory has been seen (i.e. Mindy Kaling might wear a certain leather jacket in an episode of her show. Then, the next week, Lady Gaga might throw it on after her concert for a press meeting. D'Marie can keep you updated with this type of info).

- Browse our editor's selections of "looks for less." Listen, we totally understand that you might not be able to purchase a Prada bag, but that shouldn't stop you from rocking the look. We're here to help with that.

- Share your favorite looks with friends using Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, Tumblr and Instagram.

- Receive notifications of when and where a garment or accessory will be available to purchase. Question: have you ever searched endlessly to find something you see the Red Carpet? We have. Here's a little secret: sometimes brands are guilty of promoting garments that aren't immediately available online. D'Marie will stand in line for you and the moment an item is available to purchase online you will be the first to know!

D'Marie's mobile app will enable industry professionals (i.e. designers, stylists, celebrities, brands) to do the following:

- Share content and updates with D'Marie followers so they can build their brand's identity and increase website traffic and online sales.

- Utilize their account tools remotely on set and out of office to increase productivity. 

- Publish "shoppable" content faster and more seemlessly so consumers can review the latest fashion news possible.

The success of this IndieGogo project is critical to the expansion of our brand. Our team has ridden the rollercoaster that is being a start-up. We know that what we want to acheive is attainable with your help and the success of this project. Our technology is evolving to position D'Marie to become the "Shazam of Fashion". 

 

What We Need 

The amount of funding we raise from IndieGogo will directly effect the features of the application. We want this to be the best user experience, so we have set the bar at $25,000. To create this app we need funding to do the following:

- Complete designs for the app's UI/UX.

- Contract a lean team of developers to code the application and then sync the data    between our site and mobile platforms.

- Properly test the application within the industry and consumer markets

- Cover the fees to place the app in the Apple App store.

- Create proper marketing materials that will get this app the exposure it needs to attract the industry's top stylists, designers, celebrities and influencers.

What You Get

Alright, hold on to your excitement as I explain to you what we can reward you with for making a donation to our project:

$5 - You are my kind of people. I know how much it took for you to earn this money, so I want you to know how much we appreciate your donation. I will be sending you a personal "thank you" note as well as putting your name on the Founder's List of people who get priority access to download the application.

$25 - You see the fabulous tote bag featured below? It's yours! Thank you for pulling this money out of your back pocket and trusting that we will put it to good use. Also, take a look inside the bag and you will also find a thank you note, and maybe even a personal Haiku from our contributing editor, Emily Shepodd.

                                        

$50 - You are too kind. As a gesture of our appreciation, please accept the featured T-shirt with a signature D'Marie design. Don't think of it as us shamelessly promoting our brand, rather, you being a fashion tech start-up warrior wearing our coat of arms (warning: this shirt is cool, but will not protect you in an epic battle). Please provide size and choice of men's or women's shirt.

$75 - You will be sent the T-shirt, totebag and the thank you note. You either have  great taste or are incredibly indecisive. Either way, you just made our day with your donation. 

$150 - This is a big one. You are giving us a three figure donation, so let us thank you with a proper gift. In addition to the tote bag and thank you note, one of our team's favorite emerging jewelry designer has created a special edition of her signature "Bullet" bracelet. We love wearing this piece almost as much as we love the incredibly talented designer who created it; Nikki Cast. This item is available on our site and you can view it's media history by searching "Nikki Cast". Photo below:

Bracelet Details

-Available in Rhodium plated brass

-Hardware-inspired bracelet

-Flexible circle closure with adjusting tabs

Dimensions: diameter: 3.25 inches/8.26 cm; width: 0.3 inches/0.72 cm

 

 

$250 - Very impressive move. Your donation is moving this campaign towards becoming a complete success, so we want to gift you something that makes us feel incredibly successful. Our friends at Original Grain recently completed a similar crowd-funded project. Their goal was just $10,000 but they walked away with close to $400k. It's no surprise when you see the quality of these metal and wood designed watches. You can have your pick of the men's or women's design. Both are available on D'Marie's site by searching "Original Grain". Oh, don't worry, you're also getting the tote bag and thank you note. Photo Below:

MEN'S WATCH DESIGN - Rose Wood

 

 

 

 

  • 100% All Natural Indian Rosewood 
  • Sapphire Crystal Glass (Scratch Resistant) 
  • Stainless Steel Band and Case
  • Japanese Miyota Quartz Movement
  • Stainless Steel Butterfly Clasp
  • Waterproof Case
  • Adjustable to fit most any wrist
  • Dimensions - 
  • Case: 
  •     Diameter (including wooden bezel): 43mm (1.7")
  •     Thickness: 11mm (0.45") 
  • Band: 
  •      Length: 230mm (9")
  •      Width: 24mm (1")

WOMEN'S WATCH DESIGN

  • 100% all-natural Maple Wood
  • Sapphire Crystal Glass (Scratch Resistant)
  • Stainless Steel Band and Case
  • Japanese Miyota Quartz Movement
  • Stainless Steel Butterfly Clasp
  • Water Resistant Case
  • Adjustable to fit most any wrist
  • Dimensions - 
  • Case:
  •     Diameter (including wooden bezel): 38mm 
  •     Thickness: 10mm
  • Band:
  •     Length: 220mm 
  •     Width: 20mm 

 

 

 

 $500 - We want you to know that your donation at this level is sincerely appreciated. You are incredible. You will be sent your pick of one Original Grain watch, the Nikki Cast bracelet, the tote bag and the personal thank you note. $500 is a serious committment to helping us succeed and that makes you pretty cool in our book, so please also join us for D'Marie's New York Fashion Week party - celebrating the launch of the app! We would love to meet you.

$1,000 - You are not kidding around. You want this app more than anyone. To show our appreciation we welcome you to join us this September for New York Fashion Week. You will meet the D'Marie team, learn more about the company and be our special VIP guest at the D'Marie New York Fashion Week party where we will be celebrating the launch of the app! (airfare & hotel not included) In addition, during your visit you will join Team D'Marie backstage at a fashion show to get a glimpse of just how insane this week is. Come join our team and experience the same rush that fuels our inspiration. We guarantee that you will look fabulous walking around with us because you are also getting the Nikki Cast bracelet, your choice of an Original Grain watch, the T-shirt and a tote bag.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, I pray to all of the fashion gods that you share this project with everyone you know. Bring it up in conversations, send inappropriate office-wide announcements via email, and of course, share this page link on every social media platform possible. We're talking Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, Pinterest, Google (plus, your personal blog). We accept all forms of publicity. 

You have the power to directly impact the success of this campaign and our team sincerely appreciates your enthusiasm and dedication to seeing us succeed.

Indiegogo has provides share tools that make this easy to do. Please utilize them.

Thank you.

- Team D'Marie

story:
Continue to Pre-Order at www.nettlestale.com after campaign closes. Thank You to everyone who contributed to make it happen for us. We are so overwhelmed with gratitude and excitement for the future!!!

As Seen In:

Our Goal:

To Help Raise $10,000...AND WE DID THAT, SO NOW WHAT??? The shop is up: nettlestale.com, designs have been made, materials ordered, and samples have been run. Now we are pre-selling our suits and apparel, to get this brand message and product to the marketplace. Pre-order a Nettle's Tale suit or apparel item and be part of something honest and inspiring. We're building excitement, we're building inventory...all we need is you!

*The funds raised (after and including pledge redemptions) will go solely to the manufacturing costs, to run inventory 

How are we honest?

  1. Materials are sourced locally and suits are manufactured locally in Vancouver, BC
  2. Suits are designed after and modelled by real Canadian women - their bodies are not retouched or photoshopped away
  3. 10% of all profits from every suit purchase will support a charitable cause chosen by the woman who inspired its design

Still interested? What's in it for you? 

There's nothing worse than swimsuit shopping, but nothing better than owning a suit you LOVE. Do you love your body? Do you want to? Do you know a woman that would love to know she looks fabulous just the way she is? That's where we come in!

Check out all of our awesome perks offered right here on our campaign:

 

Product Details:

  • Great on any body type (ha ha ha we're so funny!)
  • 4.5" diameter, circle 
  • Clear, easy to remove, weather-resistant vinyl sticker for your car, computer, window, fridge, etc.


Product Details: 

View product on the shop [HERE]

  • American Apparel: Unisex, Tri-Blend Tank Top
  • Comes in [S, M, L and XL]
  • Nettle's Tale logo is "Direct-To-Garment" (DTG) printed on the front of the tank
  • DTG uses a state-of-the-art printer that sprays environmentally friendly textile ink onto the garment. Unlike screen printing, the ink becomes a part of the shirt and the result is beautiful colour that is soft to the touch.


Product Details:

View product on the shop [HERE]

  • Firm, flat brim: 7" by 2.75": 8 rows stitches
  • Solid black crown: 4" height (3" frontal crown curving point)
  • Rectangle floral brim
  • Snapback closure is black
  • Logo embroidered in white & centred with brim
  • 100% polyester
  • One Size Fits All


Sisterhood of the Travelling Bottoms? These bottoms have been designed and proven to fit beautifully on a variety of body types. One of the models above is a pear-shaped size 6 pant, the other is an hourglass size 12 pant...and they're wearing the exact same size!

Fit Details:

  • These bottoms can be worn pulled up to the smallest part of your waist or scrunched down to any desired height.
  • They are incredibly flattering due to ruching (gathering) that expands the length of both side seams for lower midsection control.
  • Great for any body type: whether you want to add the illusion of curve, flatter the midsection, or sport something vintage.
  • SIZE CHART (*Models are both wearing size Medium)

Product Details:

View product on the shop [HERE]

  • Bottoms are lined
  • Come in three matchable colours! Buy them to wear with your favourite swim top:

Content Details:

  • 2-way stretch: 92% polyester, 8% spandex
  • Treated with Chito Sante: an eco-friendly treatment made from a natural biomass called "chitosan," which is made up of crab and/or shrimp shells to provide you with built-in UVA/UVB protection all day long, ventilation, quick-dry and antibacterial properties. 


Fit Details:

View product on the shop [HERE]

  • Versatile: Can be worn with the "belt in" as a robe or swimsuit cover. Can also be worn with the belt removed, cardigan-style with a dress or jeans.
  • Belt goes across back and only ties around front fabric, allowing the back fabric to still flow freely, as seen above.
  • Back of kimono reaches to the back of the knee area and is 4-6 inches shorter in the front, with 3/4 length sleeves.
  • Available in two sizes: S/M (Dress Sizes 0-8) and M/L (Dress Sizes 10-16)

Product Details:

  • Fabric is a chiffon blend


Fit Details:

  • This suit works best on medium to smaller busted ladies who are more pear-shaped. 
  • The top is done up with hook & eyes for a unique but simple bra top.
  • The bottoms channel the fit of volleyball spanks for a little more mobility and coverage, without being full-on shorts. 
  • The waistline is trimmed with lace for a feminine touch.
  • SIZE CHART (*Kaycee is wearing size Small)

Product Details:

View product on the shop [HERE]

  • Adjustable straps
  • Top comes with removable (optional) bust padding
  • Bottoms are lined
  • 10% of profits go to Anvil Island Summer Camp 

Content Details:

  • 2-way stretch: 92% polyester, 8% spandex
  • Treated with Chito Sante: an eco-friendly treatment made from a natural biomass called "chitosan," which is made up of crab and/or shrimp shells to provide you with build-in UVA/UVB protection all day long, ventilation, quick-dry and antibacterial properties.
  • Buy Now, Decide Later: View Indiegogo Exchange Policy Here


Fit Details:

  • This suit is great for pear-shaped or hourglass ladies. 
  • Sports bra-style top is comfortable and supportive for any bust size.
  • Chevron print over the bust and bottom is flattering to curves or can provide the illusion of curve.
  • High-waisted bottoms, with diagonal black piping in the front panels, draw the eye upwards to the smaller part of the waist, enhanced even further by the opposing colour blocking.
  • SIZE CHART (*Carli is wearing size Medium)

Product Details:


View product on the shop [HERE]

  • Adjustable straps
  • Top comes with removable (optional) bust padding
  • Bottoms are lined
  • 10% of profits go to support Canadian Association for Mental Health 

Content Details:

  • 2-way stretch: 92% polyester, 8% spandex
  • Treated with Chito Sante: an eco-friendly treatment made from a natural biomass called "chitosan," which is made up of crab and/or shrimp shells to provide you with built-in UVA/UVB protection all day long, ventilation, quick-dry and antibacterial properties. 
  • Buy Now, Decide Later: View Indiegogo Exchange Policy Here


Fit Details:

  • This reversible wrap top will look great on your bust, no matter what size you are: how it is tied and how tightly it is tied is 100% customizable.
  • The top can actually be tied in up to 6 more ways than shown in the images above. Images and instructions on different ways to wear the suit will be released throughout the campaign...stay tuned and be sure to follow us on social media [Facebook, Twitter, Instagram].
  • Mid-rise bottoms (just below navel) feature a V-shaped waistline and gathering along both side seams.
  • SIZE CHART (*Britney is wearing size Medium)

Product Details:

We have decided to offer The Britney in another colour option! For those of you, that have already purchased, do not fret we will be following up with you regarding sizing and colour selections for your pledge in the near future. For now eat your heart out all black version of The Britney with reversible Char Mix Grey top...so classic!

View product on the shop [HERE]

Our Goal:To Help Raise $10,000...AND WE DID THAT, SO NOW WHAT??? The shop is up: nettlestale.com, designs have been made, materials ordered, and samples have been run.
